definition:
An ideal $I$ of a ring $R$ is called a *large ideal* if for every ideal
$J$ of $R$ such that $J\neq\{0\}$, $I\cap J \neq\{0\}$

A ring is semiprime iff every large ideal is dense.

Obviously all nontrivial ideal of an integral domain is a large ideal,
and the maximal ideal of any non-trivial local ring is a large ideal.
